snippet.textDisplay:
Walter casts Agi on Minotaur.
Minotaur nulls fire.
Minotaur smirks.
Me and Flynn: Oh crap!

snippet.textDisplay: Doing my history homework to this... most epic essay I've ever written!
snippet.textOriginal: Doing my history homework to this... most epic essay I've ever written!

snippet.textDisplay: That minotaur fight was so hard for me as it was my first time playing an SMT game. I legit thought that battle was so hard that you were suppose to lose and you just supposed to last long enough until an event triggers... nope. Figured I should just fuse some monsters or find some and beat it, and man was it tough.
snippet.textOriginal: That minotaur fight was so hard for me as it was my first time playing an SMT game. I legit thought that battle was so hard that you were suppose to lose and you just supposed to last long enough until an event triggers... nope. Figured I should just fuse some monsters or find some and beat it, and man was it tough.

snippet.textDisplay:
Ah, such a cool track! : D The bells and synths somehow take me back to the first Shin Megami Tensei on the SNES...

...speaking of which, might I suggest checking out Shitenou's Lair and Ginza from that game's OST? : )

snippet.textDisplay: +Redfoxe I need to revisit this game. I've only barely explored Tokyo itself. But I was gifted this game a couple Christmases ago by my boyfriend and much of the holiday at my family's home was being curled up on the couch, transfixed on the boss music and difficulty of Minotaur and Medusa.
snippet.textOriginal: +Redfoxe I need to revisit this game. I've only barely explored Tokyo itself. But I was gifted this game a couple Christmases ago by my boyfriend and much of the holiday at my family's home was being curled up on the couch, transfixed on the boss music and difficulty of Minotaur and Medusa.

snippet.textDisplay: I remember Atlus featuring a couple battle themes on their website before the game's release and this one being my favorite. Nice bells! I'm not too sure what to think of the strange SMT x Fire Emblem game which just released in Japan, it seems like it was rated pretty high but for some reason, the game bombed sales-wise. I really thought it would be a big seller for the Wii U.
snippet.textOriginal: I remember Atlus featuring a couple battle themes on their website before the game's release and this one being my favorite. Nice bells! I'm not too sure what to think of the strange SMT x Fire Emblem game which just released in Japan, it seems like it was rated pretty high but for some reason, the game bombed sales-wise. I really thought it would be a big seller for the Wii U.

snippet.textDisplay: +notyoursavior78 Hard to say on that one. There's way too much arguing in the internet. I could sort of see Atlus trying to do that since idols are (still) a big thing there. There's a bunch of disconnection between the US and Japan that I think Atlus doesn't take into account for. Time will tell if that changes though.
snippet.textOriginal: +notyoursavior78 Hard to say on that one. There's way too much arguing in the internet. I could sort of see Atlus trying to do that since idols are (still) a big thing there. There's a bunch of disconnection between the US and Japan that I think Atlus doesn't take into account for. Time will tell if that changes though.

snippet.textDisplay:
Yeah people just like to argue on those boards it's not really about things being popular. I'm not on the internet to argue it's just to have fun and goof around a bit I guess. So I post on less traveled boards or private boards with people. 

I love Shin Megami Tensei and Persona etc, but I think what pissed people off is that this crossover game is really just a generic jrpg with a basis on music idols. It's not a strategy game really, and the battle engine seems like a simplified Digital Devil Saga.
snippet.textOriginal:
Yeah people just like to argue on those boards it's not really about things being popular. I'm not on the internet to argue it's just to have fun and goof around a bit I guess. So I post on less traveled boards or private boards with people. 

I love Shin Megami Tensei and Persona etc, but I think what pissed people off is that this crossover game is really just a generic jrpg with a basis on music idols. It's not a strategy game really, and the battle engine seems like a simplified Digital Devil Saga.

snippet.textDisplay: +notyoursavior78 I remember hearing all sorts of things about it before it just vanished off the face of the earth and then came back looking a lot different. It's a shame the studio pulled out, and I do hope it makes it over here. Atlus got me with the gameplay and sheer research it does into their mythos, and that they explore places that the States doesn't like to go. I hear you on popularity though. Seems that when something gets popular, a whole bunch of awfulness spreads. It's why I do my best to research what's up and coming before getting it. I'm actually headed into the industry, so paying attention to this stuff a little more closely is a bit more important now for me.
snippet.textOriginal: +notyoursavior78 I remember hearing all sorts of things about it before it just vanished off the face of the earth and then came back looking a lot different. It's a shame the studio pulled out, and I do hope it makes it over here. Atlus got me with the gameplay and sheer research it does into their mythos, and that they explore places that the States doesn't like to go. I hear you on popularity though. Seems that when something gets popular, a whole bunch of awfulness spreads. It's why I do my best to research what's up and coming before getting it. I'm actually headed into the industry, so paying attention to this stuff a little more closely is a bit more important now for me.

snippet.textDisplay: +Vdiffuser Intelligent Systems was supposed to help develop it more but they backed out so Atlus was stuck with it and they retooled it. I think since it was promised to be localized at one point it is coming to the United States still. I have an open opinion though I';m not even looking forward to it honestly (I thought it was cancelled at one time) but Gamefaqs seems to hate it. Also I am a huge Gamefaqs user, I just stay away from popular boards or current systems because those are cancer typically (Been that way since the PS3/Xbox 360 era).

snippet.textDisplay:
+SupraDarky Idols are a pretty Japanese phenomenon, but from what I've seen, it looks a bit like Pokemon/Digimon + Magic Girls (take your pick of which mahou shoujo series) + Uta Prince/Project Diva ^^;;;  It looks interesting, but I definitely don't get either a SMT or FE vibe from the game.  It's its own animal.


This is a great track.  I stopped in the middle of SMT4 and I need to get back to it...  It's been a while... ^^;  SMT I find is one of the hardest games to return to because before you left, you had this carefully crafted team, and then you leave it for like ... a year or two, and you go back and it's like, I have no idea wtf I was doing?!  ^^;


Thanks for the track/video!


Btw, have you heard of Aviary Attorney?  It's completely unrelated to either SMT and FE, but I think it has nice tracks and I'm at the beginning and it's currently a delightfully quirky, fun game.
snippet.textOriginal:
+SupraDarky Idols are a pretty Japanese phenomenon, but from what I've seen, it looks a bit like Pokemon/Digimon + Magic Girls (take your pick of which mahou shoujo series) + Uta Prince/Project Diva ^^;;;  It looks interesting, but I definitely don't get either a SMT or FE vibe from the game.  It's its own animal.


This is a great track.  I stopped in the middle of SMT4 and I need to get back to it...  It's been a while... ^^;  SMT I find is one of the hardest games to return to because before you left, you had this carefully crafted team, and then you leave it for like ... a year or two, and you go back and it's like, I have no idea wtf I was doing?!  ^^;


Thanks for the track/video!


Btw, have you heard of Aviary Attorney?  It's completely unrelated to either SMT and FE, but I think it has nice tracks and I'm at the beginning and it's currently a delightfully quirky, fun game.
